Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Antiviral protein DAP-32 (Ribosome-inactivating protein; Plant defensin)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the ribosome-inactivating protein family (Type 1 RIP subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Syncytkia (IC50=0.76 nM), viral coreprotein P24 (IC50=0.71 nM), HIV-RT (IC50=0.76 nM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Single-chain ribosome-inactivating protein, possessing high antiviral potency and low toxicity to normal cells in culture and to intact animals. Capable of inhibiting HIV-1 infection and replication.
Sequence Information.Catalytic activity: Endohydrolysis of the N-glycosidic bond at one specific adenosine on the 28S rRNA.

Literature.Title: A new class of anti-HIV agents GAP31, DAPs 30 and 32.
Literature.Author: Lee-Huang S, Kung HF, Huang PL, Huang PL, Li BQ, Huang P, Huang HI, Chen HC.
